21-0775.summary: Recommendation to receive and file notice of adjournment of the July 13, 2021 regular meeting of the Housing Authority of the City of Long Beach, California.Page 1 of 4411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 4:30 PMTUESDAY, AUGUST 10, 2021CITY OF LONG BEACHHOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF LONG BEACH, CALIFORNIA MINUTESA motion was made by Commissioner Richardson, seconded by Commissioner Supernaw, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Allen, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Uranga, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and Zendejas2.

21-0776.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes of the Housing Authority of the City of Long Beach, California Regular Meeting held Tuesday, June 8, 2021.A motion was made by Commissioner Uranga, seconded by Commissioner Mungo, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Allen, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Uranga, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and Zendejas3.

21-0777.summary: Recommendation to receive and file the Housing Authority Financial and Operational Performance Reports for April 2021. The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Allen, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Uranga, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and Zendejas4.

21-0779.summary: Recommendation to adopt resolution authorizing the Housing Authority of the City of Long Beach (Housing Authority), or designee, to execute all required documents necessary to accept funding from the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) for new Emergency Housing Vouchers (EHV) and funding for Fiscal Year 2020-2021.  (Citywide)Councilwoman Mungo spoke.Councilman Austin spoke.Kelly Colopy, Director of Health and Human Services, spoke; and presented the staff report.Councilman Austin spoke.Kelly Colopy, Director of Health and Human Services, spoke.Councilwoman Mungo spoke.Kelly Colopy, Director of Health andHuman Services, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Councilwoman Mungo and Kelly Colopy, Director of Health and Human Services.Vice Mayor Richardson spoke.A motion was made by Commissioner Richardson, seconded by Commissioner Mungo, to approve recommendation and adopt Resolution No. H.A. 02-21.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Allen, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Uranga, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and ZendejasEnactment No: H.A. 02-216.
